title: The Thirty-Nine Steps
author: John Buchan
blurb: The Thirty-Nine Steps is a book that really gets you revved up for killing those damn krauts. And if you get to complaining about the book's sloppy prose or nonsensical plotting, it's probably just because you're one of those damn krauts yourself. (This blurb may be unhelpful, but at least it doesn't contain major spoilers like every other blurb for the book does.)
